SEARCH
Package risk.common.entities

Klasse Country

java.lang.Object
risk.common.entities.Country
public class Country extends Object
Represents a country in the game.

This class encapsulates all the properties and behaviors of a country within the game. It includes attributes such as the country's name, the number of units present, the player who controls it, and its neighboring countries. Methods are provided to manipulate these properties, including adding or removing units, setting the controlling player, and managing neighboring countries.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • Country

      public Country()
      Default constructor for creating a new Country instance.

      This constructor initializes a new Country object with default values. Specifically, it sets the country's name, short name, and player to null, units to 0, hasPlayer to false, and neighbors to an empty list. This is useful for creating a Country object before its properties are known or assigned.

    • Country

      public Country(String name, String shortName)
      Constructs a new Country instance with specified name and short name.

      This constructor initializes a Country object with the provided name and short name, while setting the player to null, indicating no player controls the country initially. The number of units is set to 0, indicating no army is present. The hasPlayer flag is set to false, and the list of neighboring countries is initialized as null.

      Parameter:
      name - The name of the country.
      shortName - The short name of the country.

    • Country

      public Country(String name, String shortName, int units, Player player, boolean hasPlayer)

  • Methodendetails

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the country.

      This method retrieves the name of the country instance. The name is a string that uniquely identifies the country within the game.

      Gibt zurück:
      The name of the country.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the country.

      This method assigns a new name to the country. The name is a string that uniquely identifies the country within the game. It is important to ensure that the name is not null or empty to maintain the integrity of the game's data.

      Parameter:
      name - The new name to be assigned to the country.

    • getUnits

      public int getUnits()
      Retrieves the number of units present in the country.

      This method returns the total number of military units currently stationed in the country. It is useful for game mechanics that require knowledge of a country's military strength.

      Gibt zurück:
      The total number of units in the country.

    • addUnits

      public void addUnits(int units)
      Adds a specified number of units to the country.

      This method increases the total number of military units present in the country by the specified amount. It is used to reinforce the country's military strength. The number of units to be added must be a positive integer.

      Parameter:
      units - The number of units to add to the country. Must be positive.

    • setUnits

      public void setUnits(int units)
      Sets the number of units present in the country.

      This method assigns a specific number of military units to the country. It is crucial for updating the country's military strength to reflect changes such as reinforcements or losses. The number of units must be a non-negative integer, as negative values are not logical in the context of a country's military strength.

      Parameter:
      units - The new total number of units to be set for the country. Must be non-negative.

    • removeUnits

      public void removeUnits(int units)
      Removes a specified number of units from the country.

      This method decreases the total number of military units present in the country by the specified amount. It ensures that the number of units cannot become negative, throwing an IllegalArgumentException if the requested number to remove exceeds the current number of units.

      Parameter:
      units - The number of units to remove from the country. Must be a non-negative number and not exceed the current number of units.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Retrieves the player controlling the country.

      This method returns the Player instance that currently controls the country. If no player controls the country, this method returns null.

      Gibt zurück:
      The player controlling the country, or null if the country is not controlled by any player.

    • setPlayer

      public void setPlayer(Player player)
      Sets the player controlling the country.

      This method assigns a Player instance to the country, indicating that the country is now controlled by this player. It also sets the hasPlayer flag to true, reflecting that the country is no longer uncontrolled.

      Parameter:
      player - The Player instance to be assigned as the controller of the country.

    • getShortName

      public String getShortName()
      Retrieves the short name of the country.

      This method returns the short name of the country instance. The short name is a concise identifier for the country, typically used in contexts where space is limited or a brief reference is needed.

      Gibt zurück:
      The short name of the country.

    • getNeighbors

      public List<Country> getNeighbors()
      Retrieves the list of neighboring countries.

      This method returns a list of Country instances that are considered neighbors to this country. Neighboring countries are typically those that are directly adjacent or connected in some way relevant to the game's mechanics. This list is essential for operations that require knowledge of a country's geographical or strategic position relative to others.

      Gibt zurück:
      A list of Country instances representing the neighbors of this country.

    • setHasPlayer

      public void setHasPlayer(boolean hasPlayer)
      Sets the player control status of the country.

      This method updates the hasPlayer flag of the country to reflect whether it is currently controlled by a player. Setting this flag to true indicates that the country is under the control of a player, while setting it to false indicates that the country is not controlled by any player.

      Parameter:
      hasPlayer - The new player control status to set for the country. True if the country is controlled by a player, false otherwise.

    • isHasPlayer

      public boolean isHasPlayer()
      Checks if the country is controlled by a player.

      This method returns a boolean value indicating whether the country is currently under the control of a player. It checks the hasPlayer flag of the country, returning true if a player controls the country, and false otherwise.

      Gibt zurück:
      true if the country is controlled by a player, false otherwise.

    • getNeighborByName

      public Country getNeighborByName(String neighborName)
      Retrieves a neighboring country by its name.

      This method searches through the list of neighboring countries and returns the Country instance that matches the specified name. If no neighboring country with the given name is found, this method returns null.

      Parameter:
      neighborName - The name of the neighboring country to search for.
      Gibt zurück:
      The Country instance that matches the specified name, or null if no match is found.

    • getNeighborNames

      public String getNeighborNames()
      Retrieves a formatted string of neighbor country names and their short names.

      This method compiles a list of the names and short names of all neighboring countries, separated by a comma and followed by a newline character for each. It is useful for displaying a simple, readable list of neighbors in textual interfaces or logs.

      Gibt zurück:
      A formatted string containing the names and short names of all neighboring countries, each entry separated by a newline.

    • isNeighbor

      public boolean isNeighbor(Country country)
      Determines if the specified country is a neighbor.

      This method checks if the given country is in the list of neighboring countries. It first ensures that the country and its list of neighbors are not null. If the conditions are met, it returns true if the current country is found in the given country's list of neighbors, indicating a mutual neighbor relationship. Otherwise, it returns false.

      Parameter:
      country - The Country to check for a neighboring relationship with this country.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the specified country is a neighbor, false otherwise.

    • setNeighbors

      public void setNeighbors(List<Country> neighbors)
      Sets the list of neighboring countries.

      This method assigns a new list of Country instances to this country, representing its neighbors. Neighboring countries are those that are directly adjacent or connected in some way relevant to the game's mechanics. Updating the neighbors list is crucial for operations that require knowledge of a country's geographical or strategic position relative to others.

      Parameter:
      neighbors - A list of Country instances representing the new neighbors of this country.

    • hasPlayer

      public boolean hasPlayer()
      Checks if the country is currently controlled by a player.

      This method returns a boolean value indicating the player control status of the country. It checks the hasPlayer flag, returning true if a player controls the country, and false otherwise. This is useful for determining if the country is involved in gameplay actions that require player control.

      Gibt zurück:
      true if the country is controlled by a player, false otherwise.

    • removeArmy

      public void removeArmy(int anzahlArmyToRemove)
      Removes a specified number of armies from the country.

      This method decreases the total number of military units present in the country by the specified amount. It validates the input to ensure that the number of armies to remove is positive and does not exceed the current number of units in the country. If the input is invalid, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

      Parameter:
      anzahlArmyToRemove - The number of armies to remove from the country. Must be a positive number and not exceed the current number of units.
      Löst aus:
      IllegalArgumentException - if anzahlArmyToRemove is less than or equal to 0, or greater than the current number of units.

    • getUnitsMoved

      public boolean getUnitsMoved()
      Checks if any units have been moved in the current turn.

      This method is intended to return a boolean value indicating whether any units have been moved during the current turn. Currently, it always returns false, suggesting that it might be a placeholder for future implementation where the movement status of units can dynamically change.

      Gibt zurück:
      false, indicating that no units have been moved in the current turn.

    • setUnitsMoved

      public void setUnitsMoved(boolean b)
      Sets the movement status of units in the current turn.

      This method updates the movement status of units within the country for the current turn. Setting this to true indicates that units have been moved during the turn, while setting it to false indicates no movement. This status can be used to track unit movements and enforce rules related to moving units within a turn.

      Parameter:
      b - The movement status to set for the current turn. true if units have been moved, false otherwise.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provides a string representation of a Country object.

      This method overrides the toString method to provide a string representation of the Country object, including its name, number of units, the player controlling it (if any), and whether it is currently controlled by a player. This representation is useful for debugging and logging purposes, offering a quick overview of the country's state.

      Setzt außer Kraft:
      toString in Klasse Object
      Gibt zurück:
      A string representation of the Country object, detailing its name, units, controlling player, and control status.
